intro: Lacinaria tenuifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lacinaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often harvested for culinary or medicinal use due to their aromatic properties. Lacinaria tenuifolia thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
